verbs.description: triangulate (third-person singular simple present triangulates, present participle triangulating, simple past and past participle triangulated)

entries.meaning: to locate by means of triangulation
to pit two others against each other in order to achieve a desired outcome or to gain an advantage; to "play both ends against the middle"
examples: Cruz, meanwhile, could wind up in the hot seat as he tries to triangulate between his disagreement with Trumpâ€™s position and his clear unwillingness to openly attack.
